descript.abstract: The TrailNFS_Publish Layer is designed to provide information about National Forest System trail locations and characteristics to the public. It describes trail locations, basic characteristics of the trail, and where and when various trail uses are prohibited, allowed and encouraged. Because the data readiness varies between Forests, each Forest approves which level of attribute subset are published for that forest. Forests can provide no information or one of three attribute subsets describing trails. The attribute subsets include TRAILNFS_CENTERLINE which includes the location and trail name and number; TRAILNFS_BASIC which adds information about basic trail characteristics; and TRAILNFS_MGMT which adds information about where and when users are prohibited, allowed, and encouraged. When a Forest chooses to provide the highest attribute subset, TRAILNFS_MGMT, these attributes must be consistent with the Forest's published Motorized Vehicle Use Map (MVUM).
descript.purpose: The TrailNFS_Publish Layer is designed to provide information about National Forest System trail locations and characteristics to the public. When fully realized, it will describe trail locations, basic characteristics of the trail, and where and when various trail uses are prohibited, allowed and encouraged. Because the data readiness varies between Forests, each Forest will approve which level of attribute subset are published for that forest. Forests can provide no information or one of three attribute subsets describing trails. The attribute subsets include TRAILNFS_CENTERLINE which includes the location and trail name and number; TRAILNFS_BASIC which adds information about basic trail characteristics; and TRAILNFS_MGMT which adds information about where and when users are prohibited, allowed, and encouraged. When a Forest chooses to provide the highest attribute subset, TRAILNFS_MGMT, these attributes must be consistent with the Forest's published Motorized Vehicle Use Map (MVUM).

idinfo.useconst: The USDA Forest Service makes no warranty, expressed or implied, including the warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose, nor assumes any legal liability or responsibility for the accuracy, reliability, completeness or utility of these geospatial data, or for the improper or incorrect use of these geospatial data. These geospatial data and related maps or graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such. The data and maps may not be used to determine title, ownership, legal descriptions or boundaries, legal jurisdiction, or restrictions that may be in place on either public or private land. Natural hazards may or may not be depicted on the data and maps, and land users should exercise due caution. The data are dynamic and may change over time. The user is responsible to verify the limitations of the geospatial data and to use the data accordingly.

cntorgp.cntorg: USFS Chief Information Office, Enterprise Data Warehouse

dataqual.complete: Completeness is dependent on the data collected and maintained by individual Forest Service administrative units.

horizpa.horizpar: Generally the source information used to record spatial locations are from: 1) on-screen digitizing with a georeferenced topographic or image background; or 2) GPS field collected positions.

procstep.procdesc: The geometry originated as feature classes managed by individual National Forests. The attributes originated from the US Forest Service National Resource Manager application, Travel Routes module, in which each National Forest describes the trails which they manage. Creation of this feature class from the source data is automated using a combination of FME (Feature Manipulation Engine software) Workbenches, Python scripts, and ArcObject tools.

enttyp.enttypd: A collection of geographic features with the same geometry type (such as point, line, or polygon), the same attributes, and the same spatial reference.

attr.attrdef: Internal feature number.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The official numeric or alphanumeric identifier for the trail.

attrdomv.udom: Trail identifier code.

attr.attrdef: The name that the trail or trail segment is officially or legally known by.

attrdomv.udom: Name

attr.attrdef: A (required) category that reflects the predominant trail surface and general mode of travel accommodated by a trail

edom.edomvd: A trail that has a surface consisting predominantly of snow or ice and that is designed and managed to accommodate use on that surface.
A trail that has a surface consisting predominantly of water (but may include land-based portages) and that is designed and managed to accommodate use on that surface.
A trail that has a surface consisting predominantly of the ground and that is designed and managed to accommodate use on that surface.

attr.attrdef: Control number generated in Oracle to uniquely identify each trail across all Forest Service units.

attrdomv.udom: Control number

attr.attrdef: Beginning measure point for the segment

attrdomv.udom: Numeric mile post of the beginning point of the route.

attr.attrdef: End measure point for the trail segment

attrdomv.udom: Numeric value for the ending mile post of the route.

attr.attrdef: The length of the trail or trail segment in miles. Calculated as EMP - BMP

attrdomv.udom: Miles

attr.attrdef: The administrative unit within the Forest Service where the trail or trail segment physically resides.

attrdomv.udom: The six digit code is composed of a two digit Region code, a two digit National Forest code, and a two digit Ranger District code.

attr.attrdef: The Forest Service administrative unit that has the long-term responsibility for the management of the trail or trail segment.

attrdomv.udom: The six digit code is composed of a two digit Region code, a two digit National Forest code, and a two digit Ranger District code.

attr.attrdef: Describes which attribute subset is populated for this record. The attribute subset chosen for each National Forest depends on the data readiness of the trails data for that National Forest.

edom.edomvd: Includes only existing NFSTs and attributes in EDW TrailNFS
Basic subset, plus Access and Travel Management data for motorized and non-motorized uses (managed, accepted, prohibited uses).
Includes only existing NFSTs, Trail Name, Trail Number, and BMP/EMP length

attr.attrdef: The national designation assigned to the trail or trail segment. This includes designations by federal statute for National Historic Trails (NHT), National Scenic Trails (NST), Connecting or Side Trails (C-S), and National Recreation Trails (NRT); and also includes National Millennium Trails (NMT) and Millennium Legacy Trails (MLT).

edom.edomvd: Not populated for this attribute subset level
Not designated as a National Trail
All other National Trails
National Scenic or National Historic Trail

attr.attrdef: The prescribed scale of development for a trail, representing its intended design and management standards (TC 1 - 5)

edom.edomvd: Minimally developed
Moderately developed
Developed
Highly developed
Fully developed
Not populated in this Attribute Subset
Not recorded for this trail segment.

attr.attrdef: Accessibility guideline compliance status for trail segments that are designed for hiker/pedestrian use.

edom.edomvd: Trail determined ineligible to meet current agency accessibility guidelines
Trail not evaluated for accessibility
Not recorded for this Attribute Subset
Trail meets current agency accessibility guidelines

attr.attrdef: The predominant surface type the user would expect to encounter on the trail or trail segment.

edom.edomvd: Imported material such as gravel surface
Not recorded
Not populated for this Attribute Subset
Asphalt surface
Native material surface
Snow surface

attr.attrdef: The firmness characteristics of the surface that the user would generally expect to encounter on the trail or trail segment.

edom.edomvd: Not populated for this Attribute Subset
Not recorded
Trail surface is generally very soft
Trail surface is generally soft
Trail surface is paved
Trail surface is generally firm
Trail surface is generally hard.

attr.attrdef: The grade that the user would generally expect to encounter along the trail segment. The typical trail grade classes used by the USFS have been combined when they indicate the same grade but in different directions.

edom.edomvd: Typical trail grade is 0-5%
Typical trail grade is 5-8 %
Typical trail grade is 8-10 %
Typical trail grade is 10-12%
Typical trail grade is 10-12%
Typical trail grade is 20-30%
Typical trail grade is 30-40%
Typical trail grade is 40-50%
Typical trail grade is greater than 50%
Not recorded
Not populated for this Attribute Subset

attr.attrdef: The average tread width the user can generally expect on the section of trail.

attrdomv.udom: Code describes the typical trail tread width in inches. For example the code "< 6 INCHES" indicates that the tread width is less than 6 inches, "10 INCHES" indicates the tread width is about 10 inches, and "> 42 INCHES" indicates the tread width is generally wider than 42 inches. "N/A" indicates the attribute is not populated for this Attribute Subtype and blank indicates the value has not been recorded for this trail segment.

attr.attrdef: The minimum trail width on the trail segment where passage may be physically restricted and no alternative route is readily available.

attrdomv.udom: Code describes the minimum trail width in inches. For example the code "< 6 INCHES" indicates that the width is less than 6 inches in some places; "10 INCHES" indicates the minimum trail width is about 10 inches, and "> 42 INCHES" indicates the minimum trail width is generally wider than 42 inches. "N/A" indicates the attribute is not populated for this Attribute Subtype and blank indicates the value has not been recorded for this trail segment.

attr.attrdef: The tread cross slope that the user would generally expect to encounter on the section of trail. Entered in percent.

attrdomv.udom: Code describes the typical tread cross slope in percent. For example the code "0%" indicates that the tread cross slope is 0 percent or in other words that the trail is crossing flat ground; "4%" indicates the tread cross slope is about 4 percent; "10-15%" indicates the tread cross slope is between 10 and 15 percent and ">20%" indicates the tread cross slope is generally steeper than 20 percent. "N/A" indicates the attribute is not populated for this Attribute Subtype and blank indicates the value has not been recorded for this trail segment.

attr.attrdef: Land area, that may be of special management concern or interest, through which the trail or trail segment crosses.

edom.edomvd: Trail segment is in a National Monument
Trail segment is in a Research Natural Area
Trail segment is in a Scenic section of a Wild and Scenic River corridor
Trail segment is in a Wilderness Area.
Trail segment is in a Wild section of a Wild and Scenic River corridor
Trail is not in a special management area
Not populated for this Attribute Subset
Trail segment is in a National Recreation Area
Trail segment is in a Recreation section of a Wild and Scenic River corridor
Trail segment is in an Unroaded Area
Trail segment is in an Inventoried Roadless Area
Trail segment is in an Wilderness Study Area

attr.attrdef: This field indicates the Trail Class, or development scale, of the TERRA trail or trail segment

edom.edomvd: Minimally developed (Trail Class 1) or Moderately developed (Trail Class 2) trail or trail segment
Developed (Trail Class 3) trail or trail segment
Highly developed (Trail Class 4) or Fully developed (Trail Class 5) trail or trail segment
Not recorded
Not populated for this Attribute Subset

attr.attrdef: This field indicates the vehicle class or combination of vehicle classes to which the trail is open (Trail open Yearlong or Seasonal: to all vehicles; to vehicles 50" or less in width; to motorcycles; special designation)

edom.edomvd: Roads open to all Vehicles, Yearlong
Roads open to all Vehicles, Seasonal
Roads open to highway legal vehicles only, Yearlong
Roads open to highway legal vehicles only, Seasonal
Trails open to all vehicles, Yearlong
Trails open to all vehicles, Seasonal
Trails open to vehicles 50" or less in width, Yearlong
Trails open to vehicles 50" or less in width, Seasonal
Trails open to motorcycles, Yearlong
Trails open to motorcycles, Seasonal
Special Designation, Yearlong
Special Designation Seasonal
Interstate
State or US Highway
Other Public Road
Wheeled OHV less than 50", Yearlong
Wheeled OHV less than 50", Seasonal
Other Public Trails - Not In Infra
Not populated for this Attribute Subset
Not recorded

pack and saddle

attr.attrdef: Length of the trail segment, as calculated from the GIS, in miles. This can be different than the segment length which can be measured in a variety of ways.

attrdomv.udom: Length of the trail segment, in miles, as calculated by the GIS. This can be different than the segment length which can be measured in a variety of ways.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.

attrdomv.udom: Coordinates defining the features.

attr.attrdef: A field of type UUID (Universal Unique Identifier) in which values are automatically assigned by the geodatabase when a row is created. The GlobalID field is necessary for maintaining object uniqueness across replicas. All feature classes and tables participating in one-way or two-way replication must contain the GlobalID field. This field is not editable and is automatically populated when it is added for existing data.

attrdomv.udom: Unique identifier.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
